verses.kjv: If there be a controversy between men, and they come unto judgment, that the judges may judge them; then they shall justify the righteous, and condemn the wicked.
verses.ct: When two people have a dispute and bring it to court, the judges must decide the case — declaring the innocent party right and the guilty party wrong.

verses.kjv: And it shall be, if the wicked man be worthy to be beaten, that the judge shall cause him to lie down, and to be beaten before his face, according to his fault, by a certain number.
verses.ct: If the guilty person deserves a beating, the judge must have him lie down and be flogged right there in his presence, with the number of lashes matching the severity of his offense.

verses.kjv: Forty stripes he may give him, and not exceed: lest, if he should exceed, and beat him above these with many stripes, then thy brother should seem vile unto thee.
verses.ct: He may receive up to 40 lashes, but no more. If he is beaten beyond that with excessive lashes, your fellow Israelite would be degraded in your eyes.

verses.kjv: Thou shalt not muzzle the ox when he treadeth out the corn.
verses.ct: Don't put a muzzle on an ox while it is treading out the grain.

verses.kjv: If brethren dwell together, and one of them die, and have no child, the wife of the dead shall not marry without unto a stranger: her husband’s brother shall go in unto her, and take her to him to wife, and perform the duty of an husband’s brother unto her.
verses.ct: If brothers are living near each other and one of them dies without having a son, the dead man's widow must not marry an outsider. Instead, her husband's brother must have relations with her and marry her, fulfilling his duty as a brother-in-law.

verses.kjv: And it shall be, that the firstborn which she beareth shall succeed in the name of his brother which is dead, that his name be not put out of Israel.
verses.ct: The first son she gives birth to will carry on the dead brother's name, so that his name won't be erased from Israel.

verses.kjv: And if the man like not to take his brother’s wife, then let his brother’s wife go up to the gate unto the elders, and say, My husband’s brother refuseth to raise up unto his brother a name in Israel, he will not perform the duty of my husband’s brother.
verses.ct: But if the man refuses to marry his brother's widow, she should go to the elders at the town gate and say, 'My brother-in-law refuses to preserve his brother's name in Israel. He won't fulfill his duty as my brother-in-law.'

verses.kjv: Then the elders of his city shall call him, and speak unto him: and if he stand to it, and say, I like not to take her;
verses.ct: The elders of that town must then summon him and talk to him. If he still insists and says, 'I don't want to marry her,'

verses.kjv: Then shall his brother’s wife come unto him in the presence of the elders, and loose his shoe from off his foot, and spit in his face, and shall answer and say, So shall it be done unto that man that will not build up his brother’s house.
verses.ct: then his brother's widow must go up to him in front of the elders, pull his sandal off his foot, spit in his face, and declare, 'This is what happens to a man who refuses to continue his brother's family line.'

verses.kjv: And his name shall be called in Israel, The house of him that hath his shoe loosed.
verses.ct: From then on, his family will be known in Israel as 'the family of the man who had his sandal pulled off.'

verses.kjv: When men strive together one with another, and the wife of the one draweth near for to deliver her husband out of the hand of him that smiteth him, and putteth forth her hand, and taketh him by the secrets:
verses.ct: If two men are fighting and the wife of one of them steps in to rescue her husband from the man hitting him, and she reaches out and grabs the other man's private parts,

verses.kjv: Then thou shalt cut off her hand, thine eye shall not pity her.
verses.ct: you must cut off her hand. Show her no mercy.

verses.kjv: Thou shalt not have in thy bag divers weights, a great and a small.
verses.ct: You must not carry two different sets of weights in your bag — one heavy and one light.

verses.kjv: Thou shalt not have in thine house divers measures, a great and a small.
verses.ct: You must not keep two different measuring containers in your house — one large and one small.

verses.kjv: But thou shalt have a perfect and just weight, a perfect and just measure shalt thou have: that thy days may be lengthened in the land which the LORD thy God giveth thee.
verses.ct: You must use accurate and honest weights, and accurate and honest measures. Do this so that you will live long in the land that the LORD your God is giving you.

verses.kjv: For all that do such things, and all that do unrighteously, are an abomination unto the LORD thy God.
verses.ct: Everyone who cheats like this — everyone who deals dishonestly — is disgusting to the LORD your God.

verses.kjv: Remember what Amalek did unto thee by the way, when ye were come forth out of Egypt;
verses.ct: Remember what the Amalekites did to you along the road after you left Egypt.

verses.kjv: How he met thee by the way, and smote the hindmost of thee, even all that were feeble behind thee, when thou wast faint and weary; and he feared not God.
verses.ct: They intercepted you on your journey and attacked the stragglers at the back of your group — all the weak and exhausted ones trailing behind — when you were tired and worn out. They had no reverence for God.

verses.kjv: Therefore it shall be, when the LORD thy God hath given thee rest from all thine enemies round about, in the land which the LORD thy God giveth thee for an inheritance to possess it, that thou shalt blot out the remembrance of Amalek from under heaven; thou shalt not forget it.
verses.ct: So when the LORD your God gives you peace from all the enemies surrounding you in the land he is giving you as your permanent possession, you must completely wipe out any memory of the Amalekites from under heaven. Don't forget this.
